intro: Onosma tenuiflora, commonly known as narrow-flowered onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Onosma tenuiflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
